glsa.title: Mutt: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: Mutt contains a buffer overflow that could result in arbitrary code execution.

background.p: Mutt is a small but very powerful text-based mail client.

description.p: TAKAHASHI Tamotsu has discovered that Mutt contains a boundary error in the "browse_get_namespace()" function in browse.c, which can be triggered when receiving an overly long namespace from an IMAP server.

impact.p: A malicious IMAP server can send an overly long namespace to Mutt in order to crash the application, and possibly execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Mutt.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
